Package org.fog.application.selectivity

Class BurstySelectivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fog.application.selectivity.BurstySelectivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SelectivityModel
    public class BurstySelectivity
extends java.lang.Object
implements SelectivityModel
    Generates an output tuple for every input tuple according to a bursty model. During high burst period, all input tuples result in an output tuple. During low burst period, no input tuples result in an output tuple.
    Author:
    Harshit Gupta

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      BurstySelectivity​(double burstLowPeriod, double burstHighPeriod, double firstHighTime)  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean canSelect()
      If the current time falls in the high burst period of the specified burst model, an output tuple is generated for the incoming tuple.
      double getBurstHighPeriod()  
      double getBurstLowPeriod()  
      double getFirstHighTime()  
      double getMaxRate()
      Maximum tuple generation rate equals 1 (when the burst is high)
      double getMeanRate()
      The mean tuple generation rate is the fraction of high burst period in the total burst period.
      void setBurstHighPeriod​(double burstHighPeriod)  
      void setBurstLowPeriod​(double burstLowPeriod)  
      void setFirstHighTime​(double firstHighTime)

      • canSelect

        public boolean canSelect()
        If the current time falls in the high burst period of the specified burst model, an output tuple is generated for the incoming tuple.
        Specified by:
        canSelect in interface SelectivityModel
        Returns:
        true if a tuple can be emitted (selection possible)

      • getMeanRate

        public double getMeanRate()
        The mean tuple generation rate is the fraction of high burst period in the total burst period.
        Specified by:
        getMeanRate in interface SelectivityModel
        Returns:
        avg tuple generation rate

      • getMaxRate

        public double getMaxRate()
        Maximum tuple generation rate equals 1 (when the burst is high)
        Specified by:

        Returns:
